result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christopher J Smith is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christopher J Smith was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Criminal Case Settlement

Case called at 1:25pm [ma]
Defendant Christopher J Smith in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Happ verifies victim rights compliance to call case earlier that scheduled time 

The Court grants the State leave to file an Amended Information

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " NO CONTEST " entered on Count #2 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court outright dismisses: Count #1

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #2 of the Amended Information, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 12 months, with conditions:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo assessment, treatment,or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without valid prescription
--take any and all prescription medications only as prescribed by treating physician
--no contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or as deemed appropriate per Agent 
--to pay drug testing fee in the amount of $175
--to pay statutory costs
--to submit DNA sample 
--to pay court appointed attorney fees

Days credit for time already served:  3  days
recess:1:44pm
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Criminal Case Settlement
with attached elements

Case called at 10:38am [MA]
Defendant Christopher J Smith in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

recess: 10:44-- reconvene: 10:45

The Court begins Its plea colloquy; ADA Teuber interrupts and indicates that the assigned prosecutor requests a brief recess to further review the plea offer. 
recess: 10:47--reconvene: 10:49am

The assigned prosecutor requests additional time to review file and plea offer; requests hearing be rescheduled.
recess: 10:52am

NEXT: Plea and Sentencing on 10/17/16 at 3:30pm

ADDRESS INFO for Christopher J Smith

Prior: 126 W Randolph St, Milwaukee, WI 53212

Case recalled at 11:25 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Christopher J Smith in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Victim Rights Compliance Verified; Court so finds
Court reviews for the record that It had earlier issued a warrant for Mr. Smith's arrest as he failed to appear at the scheduled time of 8:30 am. Court now considers the warrant executed and satisfied and now withdraws warrant.
Atty Huebner informs the Court that Mr. Smith did not receive notice and thought hearing was at 10:30 am, he misplaced the notice he received in court. Did confirm that the address on file is correct. 
ADA Beck orally motions to modify bond to $500 cash, presents basis; Arguments by Atty Huebner
Court presents basis and denies motion to modify bond, admonishes Mr. Smith regarding tardniess today and past appearances. 

Court examines the Defendant as to rights, understanding & intent.  
Mr. Smith waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
State files information

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--maximum penalties recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
Atty Huebner requests DA PTC & STC
Recess: 11:38 am 

NEXT: (1) DA PTC scheduled for 7/6/16 at 1:20 pm - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for 8/30/16 at 10:30 am - Send notices 
**Off-record following hearing Atty Huebner informed the Clerk that "Lower" should be added to address**

Case called at 8:41 am [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing)
Attorney Karl E Huebner in court. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Christopher J Smith not in court.
Atty Huebner informs the Court that he has no explanation for Mr. Smith's non-appearance
Court orders issuance of bench warrant-Body Only
Recess: 8:42 am
Preliminary hearing on June 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
The Court granted Petition for Appointment at 4/19/16 Hearing. - Attorney Karl Huebner is appointed
Granted at 4/19/16 hearing
records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 10:00am [mo]
Defendant Christopher J Smith in court .   DA Susan Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court gives Mr. Smith his right to Counsel; indicates that since Mr. Smith is ineligible for SPD representation, he can petition the court for counsel.
Mr. Smith indicates that he would like the court to appoint him counsel.
The Court orders Mr. Smith to the COC to obtain a Petition for Court Appointed Counsel and then return to court with the Petition for Counsel
recess: 10:05am--reconvene: 10:45am
All appearances remain the same

The Court reviews the Petition with Mr. Smith
The Court appoints counsel for Mr. Smith; the Court does not make a repayment order at this time.
The Court orders that the State contact the Court's JA no later than 4:00pm on May 6th to have scheduled the Preliminary Hearing.

recess:10:51am

NEXT: (1)JA to Appoint Counsel (2)State to Contact Court's JA to schedule Preliminary Hearing
Status conference at 04-19-2016 08:30 am
Pre-trial conference at 02-17-2016 02:00 pm
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 1:20 pm [sf]
Defendant Christopher J Smith in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Svehlek advises that the defendant's eligibility for SPD representation will depend on his custody status.
Address and DOB information verified.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,500.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
-No contact with Martell Ford

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.
Attorney Svehlek advises that the defendant will not qualify for SPD representation.

Recess: 1:23 pm
NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 2/17/16 at 2:00 pm - Send Notices  (2) Status Conference on 4/19/16 at 8:30 am - Send Notices
